Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How have things been since our last session?
Hi, Ellie! Things have been pretty good. I actually started using a schedule for my tasks, and it’s helped a lot.
That’s fantastic news! How has implementing a schedule impacted your work and stress levels?
I feel way more organized. I’m getting things done on time, and it’s relieving some of that anxiety.
Classified_Subsection: Current Functional Status: History of Present Illness (HPI)

Utterance: Wonderful! It sounds like you’ve found a strategy that works for you. Have you noticed any changes in your mood as a result?
Yes, definitely. I feel more accomplished and less overwhelmed, which is a nice change.
That’s great to hear! Last time, we also talked about connecting with your niece and nephew. Have you had a chance to spend time with them yet?
Yes! I took them to the zoo last weekend. We had a blast!
That sounds like so much fun! How did it feel to spend that time with them?
It was amazing. We laughed a lot, and I felt like I really connected with them. I think they enjoyed it too.
That’s wonderful! Building those connections can be so rewarding. Do you think you’ll plan more outings like that in the future?
Absolutely! I want to make it a regular thing.
That’s a great goal. Let’s also revisit your family dynamics. How has your relationship with your brother been since our last conversation?
It’s been okay. We still have our disagreements, but I’m trying to be more patient.
Patience can be really important in family relationships. Have you noticed any changes in how you communicate with him?
I think I’m listening more instead of just reacting. It’s helping.
That’s a significant step forward. Active listening can foster better understanding. How does that make you feel when you approach conversations this way?
It feels good. I feel less defensive and more open.
That’s a positive shift. As you continue to navigate these relationships, remember to check in with yourself emotionally. Are there any new challenges you’d like to address today?
I’ve been feeling a bit anxious about a work presentation coming up next week.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Risk Assessment

Utterance: Presentations can certainly be nerve-wracking. What specifically makes you anxious about it?
I worry about how I’ll be perceived and whether I’ll forget what I want to say.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Risk Assessment

Utterance: Those are common fears. Have you thought about any techniques to manage that anxiety before or during the presentation?
I’ve considered practicing more and maybe using some breathing techniques.
Practicing is a great way to build confidence. Breathing techniques can also help calm your nerves. Would you like to set a plan to incorporate these strategies leading up to your presentation?
Yes, I’ll practice daily and use breathing exercises before I go on stage.
That sounds like a solid plan. You’ve got this! Remember, it’s okay to feel nervous; it shows that you care about your performance.
Thank you! I appreciate your encouragement.
Of course! As we wrap up today, is there anything else you’d like to discuss or any other goals you’d like to set for the coming weeks?
I think I’m good for now. I feel like I have a lot to work on, but I’m excited about it.
That’s a great mindset to have! I look forward to hearing about your progress in our next session. Take care and good luck with everything!
Thank you, Ellie! I’ll see you next time. Bye!
Bye!
